description: Unknown. First recorded in 1520. Perhaps from Old French tremouille (“the hopper of a mill”).

entries.meaning: A state of great disorder or uncertainty.

verbs.description: turmoil (third-person singular simple present turmoils, present participle turmoiling, simple past and past participle turmoiled)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, intransitive) To be disquieted or confused; to be in commotion.
(obsolete, transitive) To harass with commotion; to disquiet; to worry.
examples: It is her fatal misfortune  […]  to be thus miserably tossed and turmoiled with these storms of affliction.
